text.textblock: The following table shows the method of calculating the Effective Calculating Rate (R) for each ``Computing Element'' (``CE''):
Step 1: The effective calculating rate R.

For a pipelined ``CE'' capable of executing up to one arithmetic or logic operation every clock cycle after the pipeline is full, a pipelined rate can be established. The effective calculating rate (R) for such a ``CE'' is the faster of the pipelined rate or non-pipelined execution rate.

table.textblock: 1For computing elements (CEs) Implementing: Note: Every ``CE'' must be evaluated independently
If no add is implemented use: 1
If neither add nor multiply is implemented use the fastest available arithmetic operation as follows:
For simple logic processors not implementing any of the specified arithmetic operations
is the execute time of the XOR, or for logic hardware not implementing the XOR, the fastest simple logic operation.
For special logic processors not using any of the specified arithmetic or logic operations
Where R is the number of results per second, WL is the number of
upon which the logic operation occurs, and 64 is a factor to normalize to a 64 bit operation.
